page.description: Remove an argument from the collection.
page.original:
SQL::Arguments::Remove() Syntax Result_Flag as L = .Remove( Name as C ) ArgumentDescription Result_FlagTRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.). A SQL::Arguments object. NameThe unique name property of an argument. See the SQL::Argument object.
Description The Remove() method removes an argument from a SQL::Arguments object. Examples dim args as SQL::Arguments args.add("city", "Boston") args.add("state", "MA") ? args.ArgumentNumber("state") = 2 ? args.remove("city") = .T. ? args.ArgumentNumber("state") = 1
See Also SQL::Arguments Object Limitations
